theorem_statement: \label{cor-3-iden-2} Let $p$ be a prime number and let $A=\{1,p,p^2,p^3,\cdots \}$. We have \begin{equation} \sum_{k=1}^nN^p_A(k)(q_A^e(n-k)-q_A^o(n-k))=\vartheta_p(n)+1. \end{equation}

sections.title: Generating Functions for $N_A^p(n)$ and $N_A^q(n)$, and Six ways to Convolution and Recurrence Identities
